page.title: 17Employment in the Elton area
page.content: Fathers of the top juniors at Elton School have a variety of occupations. Several men drive around for a living. They deliver items like news and food and housing materials.Some deliver for bakeries and frozen food companies.The people who deliver news may go 300 miles and food deliveries go to France 900 miles away from home.Some men work mainly with their hands as a mechanic, in engineering and plumbing.One is a builder,another employed in a local printing works.Five men have employment on the land.One is a farmer another is a stockman and another is a game keeper.The others are a farm worker and a conservationist concerned with wild birds.Most fathers work in offices or large companies,banks etc. More than half the mothers have paid employment,as teachers, secretaries or domestic workers.
